1.3. Evaluation of HSL inhibitory activity:

Substances are usually tested in four independent approaches. The inhibition of the enzymatic activity of HSL by a test substance is determined by comparison with a non-inhibited control reaction. The IC50 value is calculated using an inhibition curve with at least 10 concentrations of the test substance. For the analysis of the data the software package GRAPHIT, Elsevier BIOSOFT, is used.

EL is released as a secretory protein from recombinant cell lines (CHO, HEK293) in high concentration in cell culture medium (conditioned medium). This is used after concentration as an enzyme solution.

2.3. Evaluation of the EL inhibitory effect:

Depending on the inhibitor concentration used, there is a reduction in the enzymatic activity, the inhibitor concentration at which a half-maximal enzyme activity is observed is referred to as IC50.
